intro: Lavoisiera scaberula, commonly known as the rough lavoisiera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands. Its leaves are rough to the touch, giving it its scientific name, and it produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring. Lavoisiera scaberula is often found in regions with high humidity and well-drained soil.
